Body:
The sample comes with temperature and humidity as data fields. Although I replaced the data with my own different fields, the names remain the same.

I cannot find a simple rename column option. How do I change it?
Which sample? Where are the data fields located? Would you mind providing more detailed information?
Remote monitoring sample. The fields are located in the devices and rules tab.

You can follow these steps:

  1. In the code, you need change the name in DeviceRuleDataFields class, for example, I changed Humidity" to "HumidityEdit"
column9:
look at this picture:
  • In IoT Device Portal Web page
column10: you need select the rule you want to change
column11: and you will see "Rule Properties" and "Edit" button in the right region
column12:
like this:
  • Press the "Edit" button and you enter the rule edit page
column14:
like this:
  • Save the change of the rule and you will get the changed data field name of the rule
column15: look at this picture: "

Body: I am using the nodejs API instead of C#. I am sure I have already tried the nodejs equivalent of what you just said. I am no longer planning to use Azure IOT but I will accept the answer for the reference of others.
